parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From peri and pipto; to fall into something that is all around, i.e. Light among or upon, be surrounded with.
From peirazo; a putting to proof (of good), experience (of evil), solicitation, discipline or provocation); by implication, adversity.
Various, of different colors, diverse, various. Of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. Various in character.
